column1: theflashcwconfessions 161022403107 "2017-05-24 14:42:55 GMT" http://theflashcwconfessions.tumblr.com/post/161022403107/hr-wells-was-the-true-hero "fuck-you-i-am-spiderman: I’m really sad about H.R. dying and I know he may not have been everyone’s favourites but he was mine. So many people overlook H.R. because he isn’t academically smart
column2: he doesn’t have powers
column3: he isn’t some amazing scientist or a great fighter. But H.R. is a person. H.R. is someone that woke up every morning with a smile on his face
column4: with kind words to share and happiness to spread. Do you know how rare it is in a person to just want to do good and to make people happy? Especially when most of the characters treated him so badly almost all of the time. They were constantly dismissing him and yet he still remained positive
column5: he still remained loyal and kind. That isn’t an easy thing to do. H.R. was not
column6: is not useless. He was a very vital part of the team because he was loyal
column7: he was kind and supportive. When dealing with traumas like Team Flash did having someone that is always on your side no matter what - that is the type of person you need. H.R. always tried to help in what ever way he could and yes he made mistakes but so have most
column8: if not all of the other characters - that’s what being human is
column9: making mistakes and learning from them. H.R. inspired creativity in Tracy. He encouraged them all to be better. It was the little things he did to try and boost moral
column10: to try and bring the team closer
column11: to always show he cared. That shouldn’t be overlooked because he wasn’t as smart or physical as the others. Remember how he decorated the whole of Star Labs for Valentine’s Day and how he made each of them personalised cards. Or how he learnt everyone’s coffee orders. How he was the first to comfort Jesse when her dad was missing and how he helped train Wally when no one thought he could do it. H.R. messed up with words a lot of the time and yes he had a ‘foot in mouth’ thing often but when it mattered
column12: when they truly needed him he knew what to say to help. Words and having someone that believes in you is not useless
column13: having someone care enough to do these little things is not useless. Being creative doesn’t make him weak
column14: not knowing how to fight doesn’t make him a coward. He gave his life to save Iris and he didn’t tell anyone about it because he knew they would try to stop him. He saved her because he wanted to prove his worth to the team and prove that he isn’t a coward. What he did was brave and fearless. H.R. was not a coward
column15: H.R. saved someone else’s life and even as he was dying he still chose to use his last words to show someone else how much he appreciated them. If it wasn’t for H.R. then Iris would be dead. So whilst I know we’re all sad for Iris I want to take the time to appreciate H.R. and the sacrifice he made
column16: the character he was and the hero he became. I love my caffeine puppy
column17: I love his hats and his drumsticks. I love his care and compassion for others. I love his optimism and his humour. I love his caffeine addiction and how through everything he has become more than just “the other wells”. I will always love H.R for being a character type that I can relate to. H.R. deserves love and appreciation. Team Flash barely mourned him but I will. H.R Wells you will be missed
column18: I hope you’re drinking coffee and playing the drums wherever you are. " False text

column2: V) (HDTV) BARRY FIGHTS FOR IRIS - Barry (Grant Gustin) is tormented by his vision of the future where Iris (Candice Patton) is murdered by Savitar. When a criminal named Plunder (guest star Stephen Huszar) shows up in Central City
column3: Barry recalls the villain’s presence in his vision of the future and fears that if he catches Plunder
column4: it will cement Iris’ fate. Confused about Barry’s hesitation to stop Plunder
column5: Wally (Keiynan Lonsdale) decides to step in as Kid Flash. Caitlin (Danielle Panabaker) offers Julian (Tom Felton) a job. Millicent Shelton directed the episode written by Grainne Godfree & David Kob (#310). Original airdate 1/24/2017. " False link

column3: Barry will do all that is in his power to avert that ending. “Obviously Barry loves Iris more than anything
column5: “and now that he has gotten a glimpse of the future
column6: the thrust of the back half of the season is Barry trying to do whatever it takes to save her” — with critical assists from both Cisco and Iris’ brother Wally

column1: theflashcwconfessions 154563487002 "2016-12-16 22:33:15 GMT" http://theflashcwconfessions.tumblr.com/post/154563487002/danielle-panabaker-by-sharon-mor-yosef "fyeahdpanabaker: While often praised for her transition out of Disney
column2: Danielle Panabaker has proven to be a more than a cute face; with key roles in shows like Justified and The Flash
column3: Danielle has proven to be an actress with no signs of slowing down. VULKAN sat down with the starlet to talk about her journey
column5: and what we can expect in the future.  You started your career acting on the Disney Channel. Was it difficult to transition and prepare yourself for the more mature roles you’ve been taking over the past few years? I didn’t consciously focus on making the transition-I just wanted to keep working on good material with good people. I kept working with coaches and teachers to keep my skills sharp so that I was always prepared for new roles and opportunities. Did having an early start in the Hollywood world help or hinder this transition? Why or why not? I’m grateful I got to start so young. I started studying acting with many different teachers and coaches when I was as young as 15
column6: so I’ve had time to work on my craft. I also had the opportunity to work with some fantastic filmmakers
column7: and every experience has helped me grow
column8: both as an actor and a person. There were certainly times when I had to work extra hard to convince people that I was right for a role because I needed to change their perception of me
column9: but I’m glad I had the chance to push myself and grow. How would you define success in the entertainment industry? How does one know when they’ve “made it?” I think that’s a personal decision-each individual has to decide what success means to them. Personally
column10: I am grateful for my job and that I can make a living as an artist. But I am also excited to see what lies ahead for me and what other opportunities exist beyond “The Flash.” Afficher davantage " False link

column2: she doesn’t really know what to make of her powers. She’s experimenting a little bit

column4: and it’s getting to the point where she knows she needs help and she’s not ready to go to Team Flash yet

column2: LV) (HDTV) EARTH-2 WELLS AND JESSE RETURN TO CENTRAL CITY — Barry (Grant Gustin) and Team Flash are thrilled to reunite with Earth-2 Wells (Tom Cavanagh) and Jesse (guest star Violett Beane). Wells confides to Barry and Caitlin (Danielle Panabaker) that Jesse has all the powers of a speedster and has been saving people on his Earth. He is concerned about her safety and wants them to talk her out of using her powers. Meanwhile
column3: Magenta

column1: theflashcwconfessions 149999388772 "2016-09-05 21:50:54 GMT" http://theflashcwconfessions.tumblr.com/post/149999388772/danielle-panabaker-the-flash "fyeahdpanabaker: STARBURST: When you joined The Flash
column2: did you expect Caitlin to have so many ups and downs? And how challenging has that been to play? Danielle Panabaker: No
column3: I didn’t expect her to have so many ups and downs when I joined The Flash
column4: but it’s been a lot of fun. I feel so lucky that they’ve given me such great material and that I’ve been able to get to play so much. How aware were you of the comic book Caitlin/Killer Frost when you signed on? Not at all! Everything I know about comic books
column5: which is so not a lot
column6: is what I’ve learned in the last two and a half years. It’s been great to learn more about The Flash and his universe and all the different characters. No pun intended
column7: but was it ever daunting going in to this role cold? It was a little daunting. I can’t keep up with all of the villains at all! We comic book fans are notorious for being a little bit too precious at times. Was that something that ever worried you when you got the role? You know
column8: I’m always ready to open myself up to criticism. I think you just have to let it roll off your back and
column10: just Shake It Off. Keep reading" False link

column1: theflashcwconfessions 148766302822 "2016-08-11 01:35:13 GMT" http://theflashcwconfessions.tumblr.com/post/148766302822/arrow-ep-talks-new-vigilantes-olicity-how "supermanliveson: juliesioux:  supermanliveson:  tsukikomew:  kalichica12:   By the end of Season 4
column2: Felicity decided she couldn’t be with Oliver until he could be completely honest with her
column3: and the pair called off their engagement and ended their relationship. “One of the reasons that relationship happened is that we wanted to write to the chemistry that’s obviously palpable between Stephen and Emily. We also really want to honor where those characters are. We left them ambiguous at the end of Season 4
column4: they’ll stay ambiguous for a while. Olicity fans will get some answers in episode five. From there
column5: we are going to write to see where [Stephen and Emily] take them. If that leads to reconciliation
column6: then we’ll write to that. If not
column7: we’ll have to see what happens. A lot more clarity is coming in episode five. I wonder if they realize the reason the relationship failed is because they threw a drama grenade unnecessarily at them. Now it’s like “Let’s see if it still works after we completely screwed up something that didn’t need to be screwed up at all.”  Well
column8: there are probably several methods by which they could make up for that big mistake. The question is indeed: Do they even realize their mistake?  I think I read somewhere that Guggenheim was surprised at the universally negative reaction to the baby mama drama bullshit.He admitted it was a misstep…so there is hope…  Why
column10: Julie. That is a hopeful sign. :) " False link
